rules.name: Data retention limits are defined and enforced
rules.description: Policy must state specific retention periods per data category, legal basis, and disposal procedures. Requires mapping of systems holding personal/PHI data and a documented purge schedule with roles responsible.

rules.name: Processor contracts include mandatory clauses (DPA/BAA as applicable)
rules.description: Policies must require Data Processing Agreements with processors (GDPR Art. 28) and Business Associate Agreements for PHI (HIPAA 164.308(b)(1)), covering purpose limits, security controls, subprocessor approval, and breach support.

rules.name: Breach notification timelines and playbook
rules.description: Incident response policy must define breach severity levels, evidence collection, regulatory and data subject notification timelines (GDPR 72h; HIPAA without unreasonable delay ≤60 days), templates, and accountable roles.

rules.name: DSAR/Consumer request workflow and SLAs
rules.description: Privacy policy and procedures must cover request intake, identity verification, decisioning, and response SLAs (GDPR ≤30 days with extension rules; CCPA ≤45 days). Include tracking log, exemptions handling, and escalation path.

rules.name: Access control reviews and least privilege
rules.description: Policy requires RBAC, MFA for privileged accounts, joiner/mover/leaver process, and quarterly access reviews for critical systems (including EHR/PHI). Document evidence of review and remediation steps.

rules.name: Encryption at rest and in transit
rules.description: Policies must mandate TLS 1.2+ for data in transit and strong encryption for data at rest (e.g., AES-256). Key management responsibilities, rotation schedules, and exception processes must be documented.

rules.name: Privacy notice completeness and transparency
rules.description: Public notice must cover categories of personal data, purposes, legal bases, sharing/‘sale’ disclosures (CCPA), retention periods, user rights and how to exercise them, and contact/appeals mechanisms.

rules.name: Supplier due diligence and ongoing monitoring
rules.description: Vendor management must include risk assessment, security/privacy reviews, signed DPA/BAA as applicable, and annual re-assessments for high-risk vendors. Maintain a current vendor inventory.

rules.name: QMS corrective and preventive action (CAPA)
rules.description: ISO 9001 requires CAPA: documented root cause analysis, corrective actions, effectiveness checks, and closure criteria. Policies must reference CAPA logging and periodic management review inputs.

rules.name: Change management and validation
rules.description: Policies must require risk-based change control for systems impacting quality or security: approvals, testing/validation, rollback, and documented production sign-off. Tie to ISO 9001 (8.5.6) and ISO 27001 (A.12/A.14).
